text: Greetings, Maria! What a pleasant surprise.
Thank you, Agent Obama! It's an honor to meet you. I'm Maria, a humble citizen of the United States. What brings you to my humble abode today?

Maria, Maria! Such a beautiful name, believe me, it's terrific. You know, I'm just a very busy man, very busy. But I saw your name on a list, a very important list, and I just couldn't resist stopping by. I'm here, you see, to tell you about a fantastic opportunity, a really tremendous opportunity, for you to become part of something truly great, something really huge, something that's going to make America great again. You know, we're talking about the best, the finest, the most tremendous opportunity of your life. Now, what do you say, Maria - are you ready for greatness?

You're a sly one, aren't you, Agent Obama? I'm not sure I'm ready for greatness just yet, but I'm willing to listen. What's this fantastic opportunity you're talking about? Is it something that will benefit the country as a whole, or is it just a way for you to further your own agenda? And what's with all the emphasis on "greatness"? Is this some kind of code word for something else?

Maria, Maria, such skepticism! I assure you, this is an absolutely tremendous opportunity - the best. We're going to build a wall, a really fantastic wall, a beautiful wall. Posted with the most advanced technology, believe me, it'll be absolutely incredible, and Mexico is going to pay for it. We'll keep out all the bad hombres, the drug dealers, the rapists, the criminals, and we'll make America safe again. And not just safe - we'll make America great again, greater than it's ever been before. You see, Maria, when I say "greatness," I mean true, unbridled success - the kind of success that comes from hard work, determination, and a keen understanding of what it takes to make things happen. Now, are you ready to join me in making America great again, or are you going to sit on the sidelines while others take advantage of this tremendous opportunity?

You: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with the idea of building a wall, Agent Obama. I think it's a divisive and expensive solution that won't actually solve the problems we're facing. And I'm not sure I trust your definition of "greatness" - it sounds like it's all about you and your ego, rather than the well-being of the country as a whole. I'm a citizen of this country, and I want to see policies that benefit all Americans, not just the wealthy and powerful. Can you tell me more about what you mean by "making America great again"? What specific policies do you have in mind, and how will they benefit the average American?

Agent: Ah, Maria, Maria, you're so focused on the negative, aren't you? You're so worried about what's wrong, instead of what's right. Let me tell you, making America great again is all about creating jobs, creating wealth, creating a strong economy that benefits everyone. We're going to cut taxes, cut regulations, and unleash the power of American business. We're going to make America so strong, so powerful, that no one will ever dare to challenge us again. And you know what? It's going to be so easy, so simple, so tremendous. Believe me, no one knows more about greatness than I do. I've built empires, I've created wealth, I've made deals that are just fantastic. And I'm going to do the same for America. Now, are you ready to join me on this journey to greatness, or are you going to stay stuck in the past, complaining about what's wrong instead of what's right?
